instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
Have an 820-3536 thats water damaged, has a green light no fan spin.

PPBUS_G3H 12.3v
PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING 12.3v
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER5V 12.3
PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER3V3 12.3
PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL 16.8v
PPDCIN_G3H 16.8v
PP3V42_G3H 3.42v 
PP5V_S5 0v
PP5V_S4 0v
PP5V_S0 0v
smc_pm_g2_en = 3.4v
smc_tx_l = 0v

someone worked on this board before and from what i can tell U7501 and U7100 have been replaced or reballed.

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: PPBUS on 12.3V is not ok, check resistance on U7100 between pins 17/18 and 27/28, voltage on pin 10 and 11.....

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: So someone messed with the ISL probably because they were hoping for a easy one and not a dead SMC. Check if pins 10 and 11 of the isl are shorted. If so, it's going to be either the ISL, SMC or D6950 (May have got the number wrong, use brain to figure out which one I mean that pins 10 and 11 of the ISL lead to ;) ) If they are not shorted, Try a new ISL. If it still doesnt work, Take the edge bonding off the SMC and give it a reflow with flux and some heat. See if it works and go from there.

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 37765"]PPBUS on 12.3V is not ok, check resistance on U7100 between pins 17/18 and 27/28, voltage on pin 10 and 11.....[/QUOTE]

resistance between pin 17/18 is 4.1ohms and between 27/28 is 20.6ohms and pins 10 and 11 have 3.42v

threads.message: Yep flux and heat SMC and see

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Try new ISL

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: swapped it twice

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: There must be a broken trace then somewhere on the data lines. I had one the other day where the trace between the SMC and the pullup resistor was broken. Also possible one of the pullups is bad or blown

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: super green here lol, so pullup resistor for this board is R7120?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Check R5380 and R5381 as well as the traces between them and the SMC.

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Both 3.42V and traces look fine...scratched the top of the trace right before it gets to SMC and is also 3.42 on both

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Might be a dumb question, but are you measuring with just the board and no battery? If so, the only thing I can think is the SMC you put on is bad.

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Yes board+magsafe only. Ill try another SMC right now

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: slapped on another SMC and no change

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Are you using SMCs from a donor board?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 37842"]Are you using SMCs from a donor board?[/QUOTE]

Yeah, ordered a bunch of boards and have been pulling them off. So you think maybe the SMC's im pulling are all crap?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
Nope, just needed to know you weren't using "new" SMCs.

Is charger light turning orange? Is PP3V3_S5 present?

Got a scope?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
Oh no I read your posts about "new" SMCs

charger light is only green

PP3V3_S5 = .006v

and I just bought a scope but i dont know how to use yet :(

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Are you using the same SMC or just some random one?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:
[QUOTE="TCRScircuit, post: 37871"]Are you using the same SMC or just some random one?[/QUOTE]

random ones pulled from dead boards i bought on AliExpress..already swapped it 3 times..but who knows..maybe all 3 were bad? does this issue sound like a faulty SMC? i've got about 10 macbook repairs under my belt so im not very familiar with symptoms...

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: Typically when PPBUS is low like that the SMBUS data lines cause it which a lot of the times is the SMC pulling it down. In your case, it's a weird one.

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: If I pull the SMC off again and Diode Mode each pin and post here would that help?

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: You have to use the same SMC from the same board number!!!! No wonder it doesnt work!

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message:

threads.title: 820-3536 Water Damage - Green Light - No Power - No fan spin
threads.message: SMC is not running at all as 3v3_S5 is also missing now. In previous post you said G2_EN was present so at that point the SMC was running so something has been messed up or your recalling is no good. Check for knocked off components around SMC and check your recalling method. This is certainly a problem in the SMC area.
